page.title: 02FARMING AROUND RINGSTEAD
page.content: Parts of three farms make up this area.The crops grown are wheat (65%), sugar beet (20%) and barley (15%) The sugar beet is transported to the King's Lynn factory during the "campaign" for processing. There appears to have been a conscious effort to conserve and even re-instate hedges,and apart from slight re-adjustments brought about by different farming needs,eg.smaller lambing areas are not now needed,the field sizes have not been increased and are usually about 40 acres,so preserving the traditional appearance. Some beef cattle are kept namely Hereford and Hereford cross,but changes are taking place and new herds are not established. A nursary is situated in Ringstead which sells direct to the public both on site and at local market towns.
